H0.text: Forms in layers is a characteristic of sedimentary rock.

H1.text: Looks very shiny is a characteristic of sedimentary rock.

H2.text: Contains crystals is a characteristic of sedimentary rock.

H3.text: Forms from magma is a characteristic of sedimentary rock.

A4.text: The sequence of beds that characterizes sedimentary rocks is called bedding. Single beds can be a couple of centimetres to several meters thick.

A5.text: Chemical sedimentary rocks have a non-clastic texture, consisting entirely of crystals.

A6.text: Deposited sediments are the source of sedimentary rocks
